attributes.action: Family allowance to be fair for all families
attributes.additional_details: Family allowance is grossly unfair to families where someone earns very little or nothing and their partner earns over £60,000. The scheme should be reformed to allow a mechanism to transfer the allowance so this is fair and based on total family income.
attributes.background: Family allowance needs reform. A couple can currently earn £50,000 each (i.e. £100,000 in total) and still receive full family allowance. For a couple where one person is not earning/on a low wage but the other is earning £60,000 or more they are not entitled to anything.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Change the high income child benefit tax charge to total household income: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/582669

Remove the High Income Child Benefit Tax Charge: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569512
